metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5213 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 55.0.2883.75 for Mac, Windows and Linux, and 55.0.2883.84 for Android allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
